item.title: Reflections #317 - Based on RuneSource
item.dc:creator: @DestriX_RS DestriX_RS
item.description:
@DestriX_RS wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:13, topic:421442”][quote author=DestriX_RS link=topic=524105.msg3813940#msg3813940 date=1321155300]
I don’t think its that bad, could you tell me what could be improved?
[/quote]Just the loading of item definitions. I guess you’ve loaded them in text for readability. But it looks like it’s ripped from a winterLove source. Having to do so much tokenising of encoded text is unsafe if you’re manually editing the files. But definitions should remain fairly constant, so personally I’d use binary storage in a flat file. Then you can buffer and safely manipulate the name and description. It would be fairly easy to write a command-line editor to modify item definitions and append new ones. This way you could sanitise and validate new editions and edits.[/quote]
2 Things :S

  1. I kind of understood what you are saying.
  2. This is for people that are getting out of winterlove and into RuneSource, do you really think that they are going to know what to do with binary stored inside a flat file? This keeps it familiar to the average winterlove user. I personally enjoy Azure and what not.

[quote=“DestriX_RS, post:12, topic:421442”]I don’t think its that bad, could you tell me what could be improved?[/quote]Just the loading of item definitions. I guess you’ve loaded them in text for readability. But it looks like it’s ripped from a winterLove source. Having to do so much tokenising of encoded text is unsafe if you’re manually editing the files. But definitions should remain fairly constant, so personally I’d use binary storage in a flat file. Then you can buffer and safely manipulate the name and description. It would be fairly easy to write a command-line editor to modify item definitions and append new ones. This way you could sanitise and validate new editions and edits.
